message.content:
cs.SI, cs.CY, cs.SD, cs.HC, cs.CL

This paper investigates the behavior of users on different social networks, which falls under the category of social media analysis. The paper uses machine learning techniques to identify and extract matched user profiles on several major social networks, which involves data mining and information retrieval. The paper also analyzes the language used in the text of the profile self-description, which falls under the category of natural language processing. Additionally, the paper investigates how different genders and age groups adapt their behavior differently from each other, which falls under the category of human-computer interaction. Finally, the paper shows that differences in social profile construction correspond to differences in how formal or informal the platform is, which falls under the category of computational sociology. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are cs.SI (social and information networks), cs.CY (computers and society), cs.SD (software development), cs.HC (human-computer interaction), and cs.CL (computation and language).
